alert.note: Alert for Lawrence (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 06 at 6:21AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast to continue. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Lawrence. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low-lying and flood-prone locations along and near the Symmes Creek is occurring due to runoff from prior excessive rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 617 AM EST, the river gauge on Symmes Creek near Aid was at 19.9 feet, or approximately 1 foot above flood stage. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. - The river has crested and is expected to gradually lower over the next several hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chesapeake and Aid. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
